intro: Pilosella saelanii, commonly known as the Alpine Mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant has small, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in rocky and open habitats, often found at high altitudes. Pilosella saelanii is adapted to cold climates and is often used in ecological studies due to its specialized growth conditions.
